name: 莊澤光
objective:
The primary goal of this course is to equip students with foundational 3D modeling and rendering skills, while guiding them through the complete process of transforming a design concept into a tangible output. The course will focus on Rhino 3D, a widely used tool in both fabrication and industrial design. Through a series of tutorials and hands-on exercises, students will develop a solid understanding of the software and gain essential skills applicable to various design industries.

By the end of the semester, each student is expected to complete a comprehensive Graphic Doding project, which must include codes, renderings, animations, and a 3D model. This final package will serve as the key evaluation criteria for the course.

In addition, we will dedicate part of the class to introducing digital fabrication workflows, providing students the opportunity to gain hands-on experience with turning digital models into physical objects.

scorePolicy:
Attendance and Class Participation: 30%

Midterm Exam: 30% (Week 9, held in the computer classroom)

Final Project: 40% (Due Week 18. Please submit your work on time; there will be no class this week, but the instructor will be available for consultation.)

Attendance Policy
Students who miss more than six classes without a valid reason and without submitting a leave application through the school system will forfeit all points allocated to their Attendance and Class Participation grade.
